descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Principles and practices in rehabilitation of children and adults are covered in this course, including the use of sensory aids, counseling, and communication remediation, emphasizing speech reading and auditory training techniques. The course is conducted completely online. It will be asynchronous; students can participate in discussions and complete assignments by working at their own pace, as long as deadlines are met. A technology fee will be added to tuition.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: This course is restricted to students in the Prespeech Pathology program. Other SPS students may register using a permission number, if room is available. Please email kate-schultz@northwestern.edu for more information.
